==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|いつ|せき|に|ちょう|k1=いっ|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
A [[calque]] of the {{etyl|en|ja|sort=いっせきにちょう}} expression, ''to'' {{m|en|kill two birds with one stone}}.<ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=|いっせき にちょう|acc=0|acc_ref=SMK5|acc2=5|acc2_ref=SMK5}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|いっせき にちょう}}

# “one stone, two birds” → [[kill two birds with one stone]]: do one task and finish two or more goals

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|一挙両得|いっきょ りょうとく}}: literally, “one stroke, double gain”
